Satellite¶

class classes.Satellite(name: str, mass: float = 1.0, focus: classes.Focus = None, radius: float = None, velocity: float = None, period: float = None, angular_velocity: float = None, known_date: datetime.datetime = None, orbit: tuple = ([], []))¶

Satellite that will orbit

absolute_orbit_conversion() → tuple¶

Calculates the absolute orbit of the satellite based on its focus’ orbit. The focus has to be a Satellite, and its relative orbit must already have been calculated. Relative orbit of the sub satellite must also have been calculated. Adds focus coordinates at t to satellite coordinates at t.

Returns

absolute orbit

Return type

tuple

absolute_position_at_t(t: float, from_known: bool = False) → tuple¶

Calculates absolute position of satellite at t. When from_known is true, angle_at_0 is taken into account for the purposes of this calculation. Calculates and adds focus coordinates at t to satellite coordinates at t.

Parameters

  • t – float or int

  • from_known – bool

Returns

coordinates - tuple

add_to_satellites(satellite: object)¶

Adds satellite to satellite_list

Parameters

satellite – Satellite

angle_to_x(angle: float) → float¶

Calculates x coordinate using the following formula: X = cos(O(t)) * r

Parameters

angle – float radians

Returns

x-coordinate

Return type

float

angle_to_y(angle: float) → float¶

Calculates y coordinate using the following formula: y = sin(O(t)) * r

Parameters

angle – float radians

Returns

y-coordinate

Return type

float

angular_displacement_at_t(from_known: bool = False)¶

Returns lambda that calculates angular position at time index t. O(t) = wt + theta0 or O(t) = wt

Parameters

from_known – bool

Returns

lambda expression

angular_displacement_to_coordinates¶

Calculates X,Y coordinates with angular position. Calls angle_to_y and angle_to_x

Returns

x,y

Parameters

angular_displacement –

Return type

tuple

calculate_angular_velocity() → float¶

Calculates the angular velocity of the satellite rad/ T^-1 w = v / r

Return type

float

Returns

Angular velocity

calculate_orbit(period: float = None, from_known: bool = False) → list¶

Calculates all relative orbital coordinates

Parameters

  • from_known – bool

  • period – float

Returns

orbit

calculate_period() → float¶

Calculates the period of the satellite (in seconds) T = (2 * pi * r) / v

Returns

Period in seconds

Return type

Float

calculate_velocity() → float¶

Calculates velocity of a satellite in orbit v = sqrt((G * M) / r)

Returns

Velocity

Return type

float

coordinates_to_angle(coordinates: list)¶

Calculates angular displacement with coordinates of the satellite and its focus using the following formula: O = atan2(dy, dx)

Parameters

coordinates –

Returns

angular displacement

Return type

float

set_focus(focus: classes.Focus, radius: float)¶

Sets focus and radius

Parameters

  • focus – Focus

  • radius – float

set_origin(known_date_dt: datetime.datetime, coordinates: list)¶

Set an origin point for the Satellite’s orbit. Angular displacement is calculated at coordinates. Self.angle_at_0 is then set to the calculated angular displacement, and self.known_date to known_date_dt. This function is used for setting the angle_at_0.

Parameters

  • known_date_dt – datetime

  • coordinates – list

to_json(filename: str = None, save_orbit: bool = False)¶

Dumps satellite and focus data to JSON

Parameters

  • save_orbit – bool

  • filename – str

update_origin(updated_date: datetime.datetime) → float¶

Updates angle_at_0 based on the time difference between updated_date and self.known_date. Sets angle_at_0 to newly calculated angular displacement, and self.known_date to updated_date.

Parameters

updated_date – datetime

Returns

angle_at_0 - float

NKepler
